Phrase en Anglais: You can set this as your current home point.
Phrase en Français: Vous pouvez définir ceci comme votre point de retour actuel.

Phrase en Anglais: Once you set a home point, you will return there whenever you are incapacitated.
Phrase en Français: Une fois que vous avez défini un point de retour, vous y retournerez chaque fois que vous serez incapacités.

Phrase en Anglais: Set this as current home point?
Phrase en Français: Définir ceci comme point de retour actuel ?

Phrase en Anglais: A home point can be set as a spot for you to return to Vana'diel when you have been knocked out. You can also use a home point to teleport to other home points.
Phrase en Français: Un point de retour peut être défini comme un endroit où vous reviendrez à Vana'diel lorsque vous serez mis K.O. Vous pouvez également utiliser un point de retour pour vous téléporter vers d'autres points de retour.${prompt}
Voyager vers un autre point de retour.

Phrase en Anglais: Set this as your home point.
Phrase en Français: Définir ceci comme votre point de retour.

Phrase en Anglais: You have registered a new home point!
Phrase en Français: Vous avez enregistré un nouveau point de retour !

Phrase en Anglais: You are now able to teleport here from any other home point.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Vous pouvez désormais vous téléporter ici depuis n'importe quel autre point de retour.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You may teleport from here to any other home point you have registered.
Phrase en Français: Vous pouvez vous téléporter d'ici vers n'importe quel autre point de retour que vous avez enregistré.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You have not yet registered any other home points, and thus are unable to teleport.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Vous n'avez encore enregistré aucun autre point de retour, donc vous ne pouvez pas vous téléporter.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: It costs ${number: 3} gil to teleport to Home Point #${number: 2} in ${zone: 1[2]}.
Phrase en Français: Cela coûte ${number: 3} gil pour se téléporter au Point de retour #${number: 2} dans ${zone: 1[2]}.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: There is no fee for teleporting to Home Point #${number: 2} in ${zone: 1[2]}.
Phrase en Français: Il n’y a pas de frais pour se téléporter au Point de retour #${number: 2} dans ${zone: 1[2]}.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: A Rise of the Zilart area.
Phrase en Français: Une zone de Rise of the Zilart.
Une zone de Chains of Promathia.

Phrase en Anglais: A Treasures of Aht Urhgan area.
Phrase en Français: Une zone de Treasures of Aht Urhgan.

Phrase en Anglais: A Wings of the Goddess area.
Phrase en Français: Une zone de Wings of the Goddess.
Une zone de Seekers of Adoulin.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You may change the method of selecting the area of your desired home point to teleport to.
Phrase en Français: Vous pouvez changer la méthode de sélection de la zone de votre point de retour souhaité pour vous téléporter.

Phrase en Anglais: Home Point #${number: 2} in ${zone: 1[2]} has been ${choice: 33}[registered to/removed from] your list of favorite locations.
Phrase en Français: Le Point de retour #${number: 2} dans ${zone: 1[2]} a été ${choice: 33}[enregistré sur/supprimé de] votre liste d’emplacements favoris.

Phrase en Anglais: Your list of favorite locations is full. You must delete an existing entry in order to register a new one.
Phrase en Français: Votre liste d'emplacements favoris est pleine. Vous devez supprimer une entrée existante pour en enregistrer une nouvelle.

What do you wish to know about?

Ballista is an exercise once used by the San d'Orian armies to train the Royal Knights in the art of the siege. The word “ballista” means “to throw a stone,” and the game has been a part of Vana'dielian military history for centuries.${prompt}
Ballista is played by two teams over a number of hours (Vana'diel time). The team with the most points at the end of the match is the victor.${prompt}

Players from both teams must search for ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} that a ${color: 5}Herald${color: 1} has buried in various locations across the battlefield. The players must then take these stones and throw them into targets known as ${color: 5}Rooks${color: 1}.${prompt}
These ${color: 5}Rooks${color: 1} can appear in various locations around the battlefield, and both teams are allowed to throw their ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} into them.${prompt}
Finally, a player's strength is adjusted depending on his or her level. It is felt that this ultimately allows for a more balanced battle.${prompt}

${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} can be buried anywhere. Once a player believes he or she has found one, the ${color: 5}Quarry${color: 1} (/quarry) command should be used to dig up the area at his or her feet.${prompt}

Sometimes a player may find items other than ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1}, such as potions. These ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} can only be used during the current match (or Best of Three series).${prompt}
Players can carry more than one ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1}, but they cannot throw the stones away once they have obtained them.
However, players will lose their ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} if they:
(1) Successfully throw them into a rook.

But don't forget, a player will be unable to use the ${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} command while in possession of a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1}. And, players can only use the ${color: 5}Scout${color: 1} command if they carry one of the stones.${prompt}
As one can see, careful planning and impeccable timing are the keys to victory.${prompt}

All participants of Ballista will have the ability to use the ${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} command. This will temporarily increase one's movement speed, creating a better chance to find and obtain ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1}.${prompt}

However, remember that once a player has obtained a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1}, he or she will be unable to use the ${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} command. In its place, though, one may use the ${color: 5}Scout${color: 1} command.${prompt}
The locations of the ${color: 5}Rooks${color: 1} are constantly changing. This makes it quite difficult to find the targets by just randomly walking about the area.${prompt}

Communication with one's team members is, of course, one way to locate ${color: 5}Rooks${color: 1}. However, another way is by using the ${color: 5}Scout${color: 1} command. This will inform a player of the approximate location of the nearest ${color: 5}Rook${color: 1}.${prompt}

Finally, ${color: 5}Scout${color: 1} can only be used when a player is carrying a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1}. Because ${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} cannot be used at this time, players must be weary of approaching enemies.${prompt}
So, a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1} has been obtained and a ${color: 5}Rook${color: 1} located. Now all that's left is tossing the stone in, right? Wrong.${prompt}
There is one aspect of Ballista that has yet to be mentioned...and this is where the real battle begins.${prompt}

To throw a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1} into a ${color: 5}Rook${color: 1}, a player must first wait until the ${color: 5}Rook's${color: 1} gate is open. This takes impeccable timing, as the gate is only open for a short while.${prompt}
But not just anyone can score points this way. A player must first take down a member of the opposing team and achieve ${color: 5}Gate Breach${color: 1} status.
Only then will his or her shots count.${prompt}
This extreme method of combat is what made the ancient game of Ballista famous, and transformed its participants into heroes.${prompt}
Running about looking for stones is no different from a child's game of hide-and-seek. Knowing when to strike is what separates the men from the boys.${prompt}
The following match types are area-specific:
All or Nothing (one match) * Normal Items Allowed: Jugner Forest
All or Nothing (one match) * Normal Items Restricted: Pashhow Marshlands
Best of Three (three matches) * Normal Items Allowed: Meriphataud Mountains${prompt}
${color: 5}Best of Three${color: 1} series rules are as follows:

Winning a match will earn a nation one “match point.” The nation with the most match points at the end of the series will be declared the victor. Winning the third and final match and producing the high scorer will result in two match points awarded. This allows both sides the chance for “come-from-behind” victories.${prompt}

Between each of the matches, a short interval will be implemented. During this interval, Invisible and Sneak will be cast on all participants. We suggest this time be used to discuss strategies with the other members of your nation's forces.${prompt}

Players will be forbidden from using any items they bring to the battlefield. Only temporary items that are quarried may be used. A total of fifteen temporary items (though only one of each type) can be carried.${prompt}
When this rule is in effect, all players will be presented with five complimentary temporary items at the beginning of the match.${prompt}
For more information on temporary items, refer to the “special rules.”${prompt}

After being KO'd, if a player chooses to be revived at the spot he was defeated, 100% of all HP and 50% of all MP will be restored. In addition, the player will maintain 50% of the TP he had earned.${prompt}
If a player chooses to return to their force's camp, HP and MP will be fully restored, but all TP will be lost.${prompt}
Please note that many of the rules previously considered “special” have been fully implemented.
Also, several new special rules have been added.${prompt}

Previously, participants in Ballista were required to use an item the moment they dug it up using the /quarry command. However, players can now stock these items as ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} for use at any time during the match.${prompt}

Players can hold up to ten ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1}, but only one of each type. If a player finds an item that they already possess, they must use it immediately or throw it away.${prompt}

If players who possess ten ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} find an item that they have not already obtained, they will also have the option to exchange it with one of their current items.${prompt}

Also, players will not, at any time, be allowed to trade temporary items. However, there are items that can be used on other Ballista participants. Please note that players may not be able to use these special items as soon as they are quarried.${prompt}
Finally, the Heralds will collect ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} when the match (the third in a Best of Three series) has concluded.${prompt}
Ballista Points are rewarded to each competitor based on his or her performance in a single Ballista match. The maximum number of points that can be accumulated per match is ${number: 0}.${prompt}

While it is taken into consideration, scoring ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} is not the only way to earn Ballista Points. Assisting allies and defeating members of the enemy forces can also earn a high score.${prompt}
Ballista Points can be traded for special “vouchers,” which may be exchanged for free ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} at the start of new matches.${prompt}
However, remember that depending on the level restriction of the match, certain vouchers will not be redeemed at the beginning of a match.
Speak with a ${color: 5}Marshal${color: 1} directly after a match to register your points.${prompt}

Players will only be allowed to score up to five ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} at a time. Also, a player's ${color: 5}Gate Breach${color: 1} status will be automatically disengaged if a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1} is not scored within a certain amount of time. The amount of time is increased for those members of the team currently behind in points.${prompt}
All allies within a certain radius will achieve ${color: 5}Gate Breach${color: 1} status when a member of the enemy forces is defeated.${prompt}
Players' resistance to sleep will be increased.${prompt}

During the entry period, from ${number: 0}:${number-2-digits: 1}, all adventurers will be allowed to join the forces with the smallest number of participants, regardless of allegiance. Open entries will be accepted until both sides have reached maximum capacity.${prompt}
In order to ensure balanced matches, the following level limits are enforced:
Please note that any participant who cancels his or her registration will not be allowed to re-apply for the same match.${prompt}
When the total number of participants in a match is less than 40, the location of the two camps will be adjusted. Also in this case, the number of Rooks will be reduced to two.${prompt}

Any adventurer whose main level is over 30 will receive EXP for participating in a Ballista match. However, no EXP will be rewarded if the adventurer fails to actively take part in the match.${prompt}
Read which chapter on B.P. Ranking?
Ballista Point Ranking is based upon all Ballista Points registered from the past ten matches in each of the three participating battle areas.${prompt}
Anyone who wishes to take part in the ranking needs to register ${choice-player-gender}[his/her] points within four hours (Vana'diel time) from the end of the previous match.${prompt}
After the registration period ends, players can compare their record with those of the previous nine matches.${prompt}

If, at any time, a player ranks in the top ten (overall) or first for a specific job, ${choice-player-gender}[he/she] will have the opportunity to receive a special ${color: 5}chevron${color: 1} as well as a new ${color: 5}title${color: 1}.${prompt}

There are four types of chevrons and titles awarded to top-ten players (gold/mythril/silver/bronze), as well as two different types awarded for outstanding performances by players of each of the twenty-two jobs.${prompt}

Wearing a chevron during a Ballista match will automatically change a player's current title. If a player wishes to possess this title after a match as well, ${choice-player-gender}[he/she] must contact a certain bard in San d'Oria.${prompt}
Also, while wearing a chevron, players will be able to trade Ballista Points for temporary items not available to all players.${prompt}

However, the rules of Ballista state that players may only possess a certain chevron for no longer than one half Vana'diel year. When that time comes, they are required to return the chevron before being allowed to participate in any further matches.${prompt}
Finally, ${color: 5}checking${color: 1} someone during a Ballista match will display the total number of chevrons that person has accumulated to date.${prompt}

You see a message engraved on the stone:${prompt}
As we pierced the gloom of Jugner Forest, my dear steed (and renowned gourmand) Morten pecked at the ground, unearthing a fine mushroom.${prompt}
Quieting the uneasy Morten, I examined the mushroom, and found that it was none other than a King Truffle, a prized ingredient I had thought to be only a legend.${prompt}
Relying on Morten's keen sense of smell, we searched the area, and found bushels of other mushrooms. A fine mushroom soup will grace our table tonight.${prompt}
To all travelers who wander in this forest--should you find your supplies dwindling and your hunger growing, search for nature's bounty and be saved!${prompt}
Just take care your chocobo does not eat them first!
Logging is possible here if you have ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}
You cut off ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, but your ${item-singular: 7[2]} breaks in the process.
You are unable to log anything.
You cannot carry any more items. Your inventory is full.
It looks like you might need two people to log here...${prompt}
You receive nothing from the moon rabbit...${prompt}
The moon rabbit has brought along a monster!${prompt}
You have to do something about those crazy trees, kupo!${prompt}
You're looking for a si-bil guard from Windurst?
Oh, a Mithran ranger. Well, why didn't you say so?${prompt}
If it's the one I think you're talkin' about, yeah, I've seen her.
Talked to her about a weird shadow I'd seen by the lake on the night of a full moon.${prompt}
Guess I'll tell you the story, too.
I was down by the southern edge of the lake a few nights ago, the big ole moon shinin' bright in the sky, when I saw this flickerin' shadow.${prompt}
Now, people may laugh, but it was no ordinary monster. And it wasn't like any beastman I'd ever seen.
I don't know how to describe it...${prompt}
In any case, that Mithran ranger believed my story, and said she would try goin' down to the south end of the lake to help with my work.${prompt}
And since you've been such a good audience, I'll tell you exactly where you need to go.
Try lookin' around the area where the river meets the lake.${prompt}
On the night of the full moon a little while back, I saw a flickerin' shadow on the southern edge of the lake.${prompt}
It was right where the river meets the lake.
That Mithra said she was gonna take a look for herself when the moon was full again.${prompt}
Did you meet up with the Mithran ranger?
Well, that's probably for the best. I get the feelin' you don't wanna get too close to that one.${prompt}
You detect a hint of sparkling dust on the tree.${prompt}
This tree looks like all the others in the forest.${prompt}
What business do you have in these parts?${prompt}
You brought this from the knight in Ranguemont Pass?
I don't fully understand what it is, but it seems to be infused with some kind of magical powerrr...${prompt}
I assume you've heard about the shadowy crrreature that dropped this.${prompt}
I thank you for all you have done, but I'm not permitted to tell you any details.
It is a matter that affects the securrrity of Windurst.${prompt}
The talisman that seals Castle Zvahl was stolen on the night of the full moon.
On the same night, the bearer of darkness appeared before the Star Sibyl...${prompt}
I am still tracking its movements, but have yet to discerrrn its true identity.
Is it a serrrvant of the Shadow Lord, an assassin from another nation, or something else entirrrely...?${prompt}
Surely you remember the bearer of darkness... It's been seen here as well.${prompt}
Haunted by death, wandering the wilds searching for...what?
For the moment, I must rrreturn home with this ${item-singular: 1[2]}.${prompt}
Chieftainness Perih Vashai sent this to me?${prompt}
No, it doesn't match the one I carry.${prompt}
Why would the chieftainness send this to me...?${prompt}
Perhaps it means she wishes to exchange your earring for herrrs?${prompt}
Semih Lafihna, Sibyl Guard of Heavens Tower in Windurst.
And who on Vana'diel are you?${prompt}
Have you not heard of us?
I have trrraveled from the Mithran homeland that lies across the seas.${prompt}
I learned that a sinner was taking rrrefuge with a tribe that lived in Windurst.${prompt}
Twenty years ago, in the time of the Great War, the tribal chieftainness of a certain region perpetrated a grrrave offense.${prompt}
That chieftainness escaped to this land, but was hunted down by Perih Vashai.${prompt}
We received word that the daughter of the chieftainness perrrished along with her mother.
The Mithran Tracker who traveled here twenty years ago confirmed the report.${prompt}
However, before the light of life left her, she confessed to her own sin: “The daughter still lives.”${prompt}
I will seek out the daughter of the chieftainness and make her atone for the sins of her mother.${prompt}
Do you not think that a Sibyl Guard is an unusual phenomenon?${prompt}
Although all the other orphans of the war were sent to their rrrespective homelands, only you few were taken in by a different people.
Was this done to evade the Mithran Trackers, perrrhaps?${prompt}
And out of those orphans who went to live in Heavens Tower, you were the only one to have no rrrecord of her parents...${prompt}
A sin is a sin, even if you have no memory of the fact. The child must pay for the sins of the mother when the mother can no longer make amends.${prompt}
Trying to switch the earring will do you no good.
That is not how I will know you as the child of the sinner.${prompt}
Let me tell you a secret.
A sinner carries the scent of sin.
It is a scent that only these king's tear moths can detect. A scent that will not fade and that you cannot escape. A scent that will stay with you forrrever.${prompt}
Now, let the truth be known!
I must apologize. I seem to have been mistaken.${prompt}
My mother, are you telling me you don't know...?${prompt}
That is no longer my concern. Farewell, Semih Lafihna.${prompt}
I must return to Windurst and meet with the chieftainness...${prompt}
Now where could Vilbert have gone?${prompt}
Oh, there you are, Vilbert. Why did you leave me?${prompt}
Stay back, if this child's life means anything to you!${prompt}
Hmph. There is much that children need not know.${prompt}
Come, hand me that letter, and I'll spare him.${prompt}
Very wise of you! There was no end to the trouble that cowardly stoolpigeon caused me, even after his death!${prompt}
So, what is written in that letter...${prompt}
Yes, it is all true. But San d'Oria was not built in a day, and little will she suffer from our profit-mongering.${prompt}
That is fine with me, because you will now die. It is a pity, my boy, for I wanted to play with you just a bit longer, and hear all about your father, the captain.${prompt}
Oh, this comes as a surprise? You're far too trusting.${prompt}
Now, I see. So this is what it's all about.${prompt}
I never thought you, of all people, would catch on. I had hoped you'd remain the dim-witted captain.${prompt}
Fallen knights don't deserve to wield a sword. Give up now and you'll live to see prison, if you've the will to repent.${prompt}
Hmph! And what if I don't? Would you cut me down, Captain? Could that blade of yours even scratch my armor?${prompt}
You can't defeat my father, you villain!${prompt}
Ahahah! You delusional child. In war, the strong crush the weak. Always!${prompt}
Hahaha! Now I see! Then let me show you who is righteous, and who is the villain.${prompt}
Don't even think you've stopped me! The plan...is...complete...${prompt}
Come, let us go home. Never again come alone to a place like this.${prompt}
I am sorry you had to be caught up in all this. We must tell Prince Trion all that has transpired!${prompt}
For some reason, you are unable to investigate this spot. There is a preternatural force at work here...${prompt}
A sense of foreboding fills the air...${prompt}
Did we make it in time...?${prompt}
Hey, what do you think you're doing!?${prompt}
Roido!? Why did you come here...?${prompt}
Come, we must return the scepter. If we just leave it somewhere near the chateau, someone is bound to find it. There's no need for you to get in any more tr--${prompt}
You know I cannot do that! I have made an oath that must be carried out!${prompt}
I know you have. But your sister is frantic that she will lose you before this is over.${prompt}
This has nothing to do with you! You have no idea of the responsibility the Caphieux name entails!${prompt}
You waste your time scratching in the dirt. I already have the Scepter Royaulais!${prompt}
What in the name of the Goddess is going on?
This matter has become entirely too troublesome.${prompt}
${name-player}! Vijartal! Please return to my home for the moment. I have to chase down my brother-in-law!${prompt}
Did I hear you correctly? Are you, a miserable Bastoker, presuming to give Vijartal Caphieux orders!?${prompt}
Do you know what happened, Vijartal? Do you know of the hero that died in battle trying to save the future of San d'Oria and Bastok?${prompt}
That hero was Vijartal Caphieux! The man who gave his life to protect Prince Fellenant and his mission to forge a peace with Bastok!${prompt}
I don't care if you hate Bastokers or choose to call yourself Vijartal! But I will not hear you sully the name of the great knight who died for the peace of our two nations!${prompt}
${name-player}, we will meet again at my home.${prompt}
Dying in battle is a fate that no true knight fears. But what do you mean by “he died for peace”?${prompt}
King Raigegue R D'Oraguille, unable to wrest control of the city from his younger brother, plotted his sibling's assassination.${prompt}
The assassination was foiled by Vijartal, but in protecting the prince, he was mortally wounded...${prompt}
Did I hear his words correctly? Vijartal Caphieux protected the life of Prince Fellenant and wished for peace between our nations...?${prompt}
That is what he said, is it not? Is this some sort of joke? It cannot possibly be true...${prompt}
Vijartal Caphieux was headed to the capital to end the life of Fellenant!${prompt}
If this is indeed the course of events, how could it have skewed so dramatically...? Impossible...${prompt}
Good luck, ${choice: 0}[citizen/comrade]. I will bestow upon you your nation's Signet.${wait-animation: 0}${prompt}
I cannot help you. You should go find a guard from your own country.${prompt}
I cannot accept crystals from someone whose rank is still 1.
I advise you to either keep them until your reach rank 2, or to use them in craftwork.${prompt}
Since we are allied with San d'Oria...${wait-animation: 0}${prompt}
Since we are allied with Bastok...${wait-animation: 0}${prompt}
Since we are allied with Windurst...${wait-animation: 0}${prompt}
I am too busy with other matters to be speaking with you.${wait-animation: 0}${prompt}
Ah, you have brought us supplies. These will help us indeed. I thank you.${prompt}
Hmm... These supplies you have brought us are too old to be of any use. We will dispose of them promptly.
I do commend you for your effort. May you succeed next time.${prompt}
You are now taking part in your nation's conquest campaign!${prompt}
I am one of the guards charged with overseeing San d'Oria's conquest campaign.${prompt}
I am one of the guards charged with overseeing Bastok's conquest campaign.${prompt}
I am one of the guards charged with overseeing Windurst's conquest campaign.${prompt}
Would you cast Signet on me?
I want to spend my conquest points.
${choice: 0}[I want to join the Expeditionary Force./Teleport me to the E.F. area.]

I want to go on a supplies quest.
What do you wish to know about?

All three nations are striving daily to put more regions under their control. This is what we call “conquests.” You can take part in it and serve your country by defeating enemies while you have Signet cast on you.${prompt}
Each region comprises several areas, and the nation that rids those areas of the most monsters gains control of the region.${prompt}
Nations receive goods and resources from regions under their control.${prompt}
So, the more regions we control, the richer our nation becomes.${prompt}
Border guards are also placed in outposts within regions under our control.
They are there to cast Signet on adventurers like yourself.${prompt}
Once you have your nation's Signet, you will be able to acquire crystals from enemies you defeat.${prompt}

Not only that, but you will also receive conquest points. You get more conquest points if you defeat enemies in regions that are not under your nation's control. These points can be used to purchase items from guards like myself.${prompt}
So you see...conquests benefit nations and adventurers alike.
We expect you to do your best to serve your country.${prompt}
You can see the current state of conquests by selecting “Region Info” from the main menu.
Conquest results in all regions are regularly recalculated, so you may want to check them from time to time.${prompt}
Shops in our city will be selling different items according to our conquest rank.
The Troupe Valeriano will also visit the nation that finishes first and bring a little joy to its citizens.${prompt}
You can donate crystals to your nation once you achieve rank 2.
Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.${prompt}
We would like you to donate crystals to your nation from now on.
Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.${prompt}
You can acquire crystals by defeating enemies while you have your nation's Signet.
Having Signet cast on you is also the only way of taking part in conquests.${prompt}
Rank points will be awarded to you for each crystal you donate, and you may be offered new missions as your rank goes up.${prompt}
You also receive rank points for completing missions.
Complete missions and take part in conquests to raise your rank and serve your country.${prompt}
You are awarded conquest points when you defeat monsters while you are taking part in conquests.
Select "Region Info" from the menu to check your current number of conquest points.${prompt}
You can purchase items from guards like myself with your conquest points, but be warned that the number of points you spend will be subtracted from your current total.${prompt}

When conquest results are announced, you will be told which country controls the region you are in at that time. Sometimes regions may become neutral, or beastmen may even gain control of regions.${prompt}
If we gain control of a region, border guards will be placed at its outposts to help adventurers like you.${prompt}
Merchants will also be placed there, and goods from that region will find their way to the local shops here.${prompt}
Gaining control of regions is the basic principle behind conquests. We need each of you to do your best, and bring our nation to the top of the ranks.${prompt}
Of course, sometimes we lose regions to other nations...so we must try to take them back before the next conquest results are announced.${prompt}
As an incentive, we will award you with more conquest points for defeating monsters in those regions.${prompt}

But if we are allied with another nation, you will only be awarded the regular rate for defeating monsters in our allies' regions. On the other hand, we will award you with more points for fighting in the top-ranked nation's regions.${prompt}
Our paramount concern lies in the beastmen gaining control of our regions.
If too many of us are defeated in a region, the beastmen will gain control of it.${prompt}
If this happens, not only is it a great blow to our pride, but you will be unable to acquire any crystals in that region.${prompt}
The beastmen are a menace to all nations. If they rise to power, we must all unite and drive those vile creatures from that region.${prompt}
We need you to bring supplies to the outpost border guards who are placed in regions under our control.${prompt}
There is one outpost in each region. Select “Region Info” from the menu, and look for the areas with a small flag mark on the map. That is where they are.${prompt}
Here are the supplies. Just give them to the guard at the outpost and your mission will be complete.
Now, choose which outpost you want to go to. We give different rewards for each region, so choose carefully.${prompt}

You have until the next conquest results announcement to complete this mission.
We will dispose of those unusable supplies.${prompt}
You can only undertake one supply mission per day.

Phrase en Français: Téléporter avec des points de conquête.

Phrase en Anglais: Welcome to the border shop! If you trade me unused equipment, I'll add their value to your country's region points!${prompt}
It should please you to know that I now also deal in ${item-plural: 0[2]}.

Phrase en Anglais: Bigger pieces will earn you more points for your nation, and I'll even toss some gil into the equation!${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I see that your home country has control of this region. Feel free to browse through my wares.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I can teleport you to your home country for ${number: 1} gil or ${number: 3} conquest ${choice-plurality: 3}[point/points].${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Word has it that the entire set of mog tablets has been recovered.
Phrase en Français: Je peux vous téléporter vers votre pays d’origine pour ${number: 1} gil ou ${number: 3} ${choice-plurality: 3}[point/points] de conquête.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Oh, happy day! In honor of the occasion, I can teleport you to your home country free of charge.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I am terribly sorry, but it seems as if you do not have enough gil.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Oh, jour heureux ! En l'honneur de l'occasion, je peux vous téléporter vers votre pays d'origine gratuitement.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I am terribly sorry, but it seems as if you do not have enough conquest points.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je suis désolé, mais il semble que vous n'ayez pas assez de gils.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: However, due to your home country's lack of influence in the region, this is the only transaction I am authorized to perform with you at the moment.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je suis désolé, mais il semble que vous n'ayez pas assez de points de conquête.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I am looking forward to doing business with you again in the future!${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Cependant, en raison du manque d'influence de votre pays d'origine dans la région, c'est la seule transaction que je suis autorisé à effectuer avec vous pour le moment.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Thank you. This will increase your nation's region points by a small amount. If you have anything else, by all means, trade them to me.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Thank you. This will increase your nation's region points moderately. If you have anything else, by all means, trade them to me.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Merci. Cela augmentera légèrement les points de région de votre nation. Si vous avez d'autres objets, n'hésitez pas à me les échanger.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: Merci. Cela augmentera modérément les points de région de votre nation. Si vous avez d'autres objets, n'hésitez pas à me les échanger.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I could not accept one or more items you tried to trade me. Please remove those items and try again.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: My apologies, but this type of item needs to be individually appraised. Please trade them to me one at a time.${prompt}

I'd like to set my home point here.

Phrase en Français: Faites de votre mieux pour débarrasser le monde de ces créatures viles.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: Grâce à vous, notre nation est désormais en tête de la course à la conquête !

Phrase en Anglais: This ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} is no longer valid. We will dispose of it here.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: Vous avez reçu l'autorisation de rejoindre les Forces Expéditionnaires !${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Welcome back from the expedition. Our nation was successful in its campaign. Let me give you your reward.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Actuellement, nous sommes classés premiers dans la conquête de Vana'diel, mais cela ne doit pas être pris pour acquis. Nous devons continuer notre lutte pour rester au sommet.${prompt}

Nous avions la première place entre nos mains, mais nous l'avons laissée filer. Si nous voulons être classés premiers à Vana'diel, chacun de nous doit faire sa part. J'attends avec impatience de vos nouvelles réalisations.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: When participating in an Expeditionary Force, concentrate your efforts on fighting foes that give you the most experience points. And don't forget to confiscate the contents of any beastman treasure chest you happen to come upon.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Notre pays est tombé à la troisième place dans la conquête de Vana'diel. Nous devons intensifier nos efforts pour améliorer la situation.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I will now hand you your insignia. Be sure to read the inscription on the back before you begin your duties.
Phrase en Français: Vous devez combattre dans des batailles qui rapportent de hauts niveaux d'expérience. C'est le seul moyen de mettre des zones sous le contrôle de notre pays.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Once Signet has been bestowed upon you, prepare to be teleported.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Actuellement, notre pays est la force dominante dans cette région. Si nous maintenons ce niveau, le contrôle de cette zone sera le nôtre.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You could not be teleported. Ask me again, please.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Actuellement, notre pays est une force majeure dans cette région. Cependant, nous ne pouvons pas le prendre pour acquis. Si nous baissons notre garde, nous perdrons sûrement le contrôle de la zone !${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: The conquest results are currently being tallied. Come back later.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Actuellement, notre pays n'a qu'une influence mineure dans cette région. Nous comptons sur vous pour nous sortir de ce trou que nous nous sommes creusé.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You have received permission to join the Expeditionary Forces!${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Actuellement, l'influence de notre pays dans cette zone est minime. Si nous n'agissons pas rapidement, le contrôle de cette région sera certainement pris par un pays rival.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Currently we rank first in Vana'diel's conquest, but that must not be taken for granted. We must continue our fight to remain on top.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Faites attention en passant par ici, car cette zone est actuellement envahie par les bêtes ! Quelque chose doit être fait, sinon l'ennemi aura le contrôle de toute la région.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: We had first place in our hands, but we let it slip away. If we want to be ranked first in Vana'diel, each and every one of us must do their part. I look forward to hearing of your achievements.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Votre inventaire est plein. Vous n’avez pas pu accepter le ${item-singular: 0[2]}.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Our country has fallen to third in the conquest of Vana'diel. We must step up our efforts to improve the situation.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Vous possédez déjà un glyphe de porte. Vous ne pouvez pas en contenir plus.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You must fight in battles that gain high levels of experience. This is the only way we can bring areas under our country's control.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je suis un Garde Ducal de Jeuno, ${name-npc}. Ma mission est de soutenir les efforts de conquête de Windurst, San d'Oria et Bastok.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Currently, our country is the dominant force in this region. If we can maintain this level, control of this area will be ours.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: I am the will of the realm's guardian wyrms made manifest, and in accordance with the Far Eastern calendar, this year belongs to us!
May the soil be fertile and the harvests bountiful in the coming months.${prompt}

You currently stand in the eye of a raging maelstrom. Embark upon those winds and let them carry you to glory, obliterating all who dare defy you.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Happy New Year, from me and my bouncy-wouncy little companion here!${prompt}

You must wait longer before you are able to register a new training regime. It is recommended that you use this time to recuperate.${prompt}
“Elite training” is a section of the Field Manual which caters to dauntless adventurers who wish to engage in a more grueling test of their mettle.${prompt}
To participate in elite training regimes, you must acquire chapter transcripts, for which tabs are required.${prompt}
Trading ${item-plural: 35[2]}, gil, or a piece of equipment at designated locations (while in possession of a chapter transcript) will trigger the commencement of your training.${prompt}
Traded items will not be returned to you. You will, however, be furnished with rewards of correlating value upon the successful completion of each elite training regime.${prompt}
Even within elite training, there are regimes of varying difficulty. The trade limit for each succeeding chapter will be greater than the last, and the training objective more challenging.
For safety reasons, all participants are recommended to be well prepared.${prompt}

Lastly, we at the A.M.A.N. recognize the importance of rest and recuperation as part of a healthy adventuring lifestyle. Therefore, a mandatory cool-down period will be imposed upon all adventurers following the completion of an elite training regime. Until this time has elapsed, you will be unable to undertake further training, even if a chapter transcript is in your possession.${prompt}
You cannot undertake a training regime while a hunt is active.${prompt}
${color-alt: 141}The requisite time has not yet elapsed since undertaking your last regime.
You may be ineligible to receive gil and tab rewards.
Set training regime to automatically repeat upon completion?
That's odd, there's nothing growing here...
Did the bulb fail to sprout?${prompt}
Owww... It feels like a tree fell on me...${prompt}
Hooray! Let's take it to Amaura without delay!${prompt}
Your presence has drawn unwanted attention!${prompt}
Now is not the time for that!${prompt}
You sense an unusual presence in the area...${prompt}
There is nothing out of the ordinary here.${prompt}
You must deliver the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} to Amaura in Southern San d'Oria.${prompt}
Are there ever times when you wish you could...change the past?${prompt}
Truly? Then that is one more facet in which we two are alike.${prompt}
Truly? Words cannot describe how much I envy you.${prompt}
That question must have seemed rather out of the blue.
The words Zogbog spoke, you see, of being able to travel between eras--they recalled to mind a fateful time in my past.${prompt}
'Twas early in the war, shortly before San d'Oria came under siege by the Bloodwing Horde...${prompt}
Aye. My unit departs on the morrow.
We're not like to step on Kingdom soil for some time.${prompt}
But...you promised you'd be here with us to celebrate Mother's birthday next week!${prompt}
I charge you with your mother's care in my absence.
Promise me you'll keep her safe until my return.${prompt}
Shortly thereafter, hell came to San d'Oria in the form of Doggvdegg and his Bloodwing Horde.
The paltry force that was left to defend the city did not long withstand the enemy's relentless onslaught.
The Orcs soon breached the city walls, leaving death and destruction in their wake.
Y-you'll not touch a s-single strand of h-hair on her head!${prompt}
I failed to uphold my promise. Never before had I felt so powerless.${prompt}
Racked with shame and grief, I sought escape the only way I knew how: I cast the blame on my father.${prompt}
Time and again I convinced myself that the fault lay with him--that he abandoned Mother in her time of need.${prompt}
Looking back now, I was naught but a pathetic coward who hid from the pain with a veil of anger.${prompt}
Were I given a chance to alter the past, I would protect Mother and make good my promise to Father.${prompt}
Egads, this wishy-washy prattle fair makes my ears bleed.${prompt}
A spoony weakling such as you couldn't hope to change history. As well try to stop the setting of the sun.${prompt}
Who said that!? Show yourself this instant!${prompt}
F-Father!? B-but...hadn't we already defeated that mannequin!?${prompt}
No, wait... This one is different than before.
Reveal your true identity, you abomination!${prompt}
Tsk-tsk. Is this how children these days show respect to their elders? With the sharp end of a blade and a tongue to match?${prompt}
Elder or no, I heard what you called me: a weakling, and a spoony one besides! I'll not tolerate it!${prompt}
Aye, such I did call you, and you'd best learn to tolerate the truth--nay, embrace it--if 'tis truly your desire to grow strong enough to bring about change.
Now, listen well, boy. Your stance bespeaks solid groundwork, but the quivering tip of your blade betrays a lack of resolve.${prompt}
Have I illustrated my point, boy?
You don indecisiveness as if it were a suit of armor, one that does naught but weigh you down. You must learn to cast it aside.${prompt}
I hope your tardiness means you've something to show for it. Have you secured the extra hands we require?${prompt}
Certainly, sir: the two standing before you!${prompt}
If they're moony as you say, then affirmative, sir!${prompt}
If you would accompany me to base camp, I shall brief you regarding the details of the strategy.${prompt}

I shall tutor you on swordsmanship. From the fundamentals and the application thereof, to martial strategy and the strengthening of mental resilience--all these things I shall pour unto you from my fount of knowledge.${prompt}
I don't recall enlisting you as my tutor, thank you very much!
Besides, I'll have you know that I've advanced beyond the need for further--${prompt}
Mind your insolence! If you wish to grow out of your own shadow as a swordsman, you will accept my offer of tutelage and be thankful! Now, come!
Bostillette. You may go on ahead.
I shall join you at the engineers' encampment after my business here is done.${prompt}
Hehehe... Let's leave those two to settle their differences, shall we?${prompt}
Hmm? This place seems awfully familiar...
Have we circled back to where we began?${prompt}
How positively odd. According to the map, this should be the right direction...${prompt}
I've gotten us lost, you say!? Well, I never!${prompt}
I suppose you've never in your life taken a wrong turn when immersed in thought!${prompt}
Hmph! If it would put finis to your grumbling, please be my guest and lead the way!${prompt}
You possess a map of the area, I trust?
The encampment is a short ways northeast of the entrance to the La Theine Plateau! Mind you don't get us lost!${prompt}
Eagerly have we awaited your return.${prompt}
Be this the person whom you've recruited to assist us?${prompt}
Affirmative. The aid ${choice-player-gender}[he/she] has volunteered shall prove pivotal to the strategy.${prompt}
My name is Pignoit, and I have the honor of serving under Chief Engineer Bostillette.${prompt}
Likewise for I, Fransont. Jolly good to have you on board!${prompt}
Sir. But moments ago word arrived from our Ghelsba-based operative.${prompt}
Fangmonger Zogbog has resurfaced at the Orcish stronghold.${prompt}
So, after an extended absence, the infamous military tactician-turned-research exponent finally makes his return...
But we, the Iron Ram Engineers, shall be as a spanner thrown into the works of Zogbog's dastardly plans.

Allow me to explain the situation, ${name-player}. Some time ago, it came to light that the Orcs were conducting arcane research on powerful magic statues for use in warfare in the deepest interior of Fort Ghelsba.${prompt}
These constructs have been in development behind closed doors for the past two decades, and our intelligence operatives have brought alarming reports that their unveiling is nigh.${prompt}
There is no telling the destructive potential of the statues, but this much is certain: they must not be given the chance to wreak havoc upon the Kingdom.${prompt}
Masterminding the development is Zogbog, whom we believe seeks to exact revenge for the Orcish defeat in the Crystal War.${prompt}
With the Royal Knight General's endorsement, we've devised a covert strategy to infiltrate the enemy's lair and destroy the statues before they can be used against us.${prompt}
The gravity of our mission is such that numerous safeguards have been employed to ensure the Orcs are kept ignorant of our plan.${prompt}
Even so, Chief, I fail to see the need for all involved to call each other by code names.${prompt}
Thus far it has proven to be a right royal pain when communicating with fellow strategy members.${prompt}
A valid concern, soldier. If you find not unpleasant the idea of joining the hapless souls who met with foul play during the Great War, then by all means wear your identity on your sleeve.${prompt}
<Gulp> R-remarkably well put, sir. Mayhap a little inconvenience would not kill me after all...literally.${prompt}
Hehehe, it gladdens me to see that you understand.
Now then, the hour of reckoning draws nigh.${prompt}
Has the commander not yet arrived?${prompt}
If you seek Commander Excen--I mean, Maxcimille, he was seen striking for Ghelsba with a young lad in tow.${prompt}
Far be it from me to spread gossip, but I never imagined the commander had the time to rear a child, let alone take a woman to wife.${prompt}
Ah, yes. Hefting matching swords and wearing identical frowns, they were indeed a heartwarming sight to behold!${prompt}
Ohohoho. Verily, there is far more to our fearless leader than meets the eye.${prompt}
Now, without further ado, ${name-player}, pray make for Ghelsba and rejoin the commander and his young companion.${prompt}
There you will rendezvous with our operative and be furnished with additional information.${prompt}
I must needs see to the unit's final preparations, but shall be on my way presently.${prompt}
${name-player} recorded survey data for ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} on the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}.
You've recovered one of the long-lost mog tablets!
You should share the news of your discovery with the Explorer Moogle in Ru'Lude Gardens.
You've heard the tale of the mog tablets, haven't you?
If any of them turn up in your travels, promise you'll let me know, kupo!${prompt}
Thanks to your efforts, the mog tablets have been recovered, and their magic freed to spread happiness and joy across the realm!
You are truly a friend to all mooglekind, kupo!${prompt}
Oh no! What a shame, kupo!
The mog tablets that were recovered have been scattered to the ends of Vana'diel once more...${prompt}
What's a mog tablet!? What's a mog tablet, you say!?
Why, only the most awesome, amazing artifact in the annals of moogle history, that's what, kupo!${prompt}
There's eleven of them in all, to be exact, scattered to the far reaches of Vana'diel and just waiting to be discovered by brave adventurers like you!${prompt}
What happens if you find them? I thought you'd never ask, kupo!

Each tablet is inscribed with an ancient moogle poem of joy, and legend has it that if all are found, the ancient moogle magic of King Kupofried the Great will be released once more, spreading joy and happiness through all the land!${prompt}
We explorer moogles have made it our life's work to recover the tablets and unlock their powers.
But with these short legs and little-bitty wings, we can't do it alone, kupo!${prompt}
There! I've whipped up a spell that will instantly transport any tablets you find back here to me.
Come back if you find anything, and happy exploring, kupo!${prompt}
Just sit right back and I'll tell you the tale, kupo.
Many, many ages past, we moogles had our own glorious kingdom.
It was truly the peak of moogle civilization, a veritable golden age for all mooglekind!${prompt}
The seventh king of this great nation was the wise and kindly King Kupofried, a masterful magician famed as the father of the fantastic moogle magic that survives to this very day, kupo!${prompt}
In his later years, King Kupofried embarked on what would become the greatest work of his illustrious reign.
Seeking to pass down the prosperity of his kingdom to future generations, he inscribed eleven incantations of moogle joy and happiness onto eleven stone tablets.${prompt}
Sadly, the kindly king's intentions went unappreciated by his selfish sons and daughters, and many a fierce feud broke out over who would inherit these relics, kupo...${prompt}
How could the poems that he had composed out of pure love and joy become the root of such strife?${prompt}
In his despair, the king commanded his minion bats to scatter the tablets to the far corners of the world, where they would be seen by moogle eyes no more.${prompt}
“Alas! I only wanted my children to be happy, kupo,” he lamented, and flew away on his tiny yet majestic wings, never to be seen in his kingdom again.${prompt}
Left without its wise monarch, the once-glorious moogle kingdom fractured into warring tribes, falling into unrest...and, eventually, ruin.
A tragic tale, don't you think, kupo?${prompt}
We explorer moogles are the proud descendants of King Kupofried, living only to bring our last great monarch's unrealized dream to fruition.
We will--we must!--find the mog tablets and bring true joy and happiness to this world!${prompt}
It appears that ${number: 0} moogle ${choice-plurality: 0}[tablet has/tablets have] already been found, kupo.${prompt}
Here's a list of all the located tablets, kupo!${prompt}
The tablet of ${choice: 0}[temperance/fortitude/piety/justice/hope/wisdom/compassion/dignity/loyalty/charity/courage] was discovered there by ${entity: 0}, kupo!${prompt}
The tablet of ${choice: 0}[temperance/fortitude/piety/justice/hope/wisdom/compassion/dignity/loyalty/charity/courage] was discovered there, kupo!${prompt}
No tablet has been discovered there yet.
It's not too late for you to stake your claim, kupo!${prompt}
All eleven mog tablets have been recovered and restored to their rightful place at the altar of King Kupofried!${prompt}
Can you feel the ancient moogle magic in the air?
You can now bask in the benefits of this Super Kupower...${prompt}
A special treat for the cost-conscious adventurer!
For a limited time, all survival guide costs are eliminated, and you are able to teleport between nearby cities for a small fee, kupo!${prompt}
As an added bonus to your Signet, combat skills will increase more rapidly! Your magic and automaton skills will be boosted, too!${prompt}
Signets have been boosted with the abilities of Regeneration and Refresh!${prompt}
With Signet in effect, you will now be able to sniff out more treasure and gil! Great riches surely await you, kupo!${prompt}
Good news for aspiring artisans, kupo! When receiving advanced image support, the chance of your ingredients being lost in a failed synthesis attempt has been drastically reduced!${prompt}
What's this, kupo? Mysterious boxes have been sighted all over the realm!
What genius could have devised such commendable creations?${prompt}
Not content to be left behind, brown magic slides back out for another go, kupo!
Now you can be what you eat for twice as long and save on all those trips to your local merchant.${prompt}
Trust in Signet and you can never go wrong, kupo!
It's time to take to the field and vanquish a veritable army of enemies, for any Conquest Points you receive will be duly doubled!${prompt}
Trade routes are bustling with unprecedented traffic and peddlers' carts are overflowing with objects now that regional goods are available to merchants across the realm, kupo!${prompt}
This is just the ticket for today's busy adventurer! For a limited time, provided that you're fully rested and healed, your legs will carry you with the speed of a chocobo!${prompt}
Signet is now better than ever! Collect crystals from beastmen-controlled areas...and maybe even clusters from other areas!${prompt}
Be warned that our moogle magic is concentrated around this altar.
If you venture to far-off lands, the Super Kupowers will be unable to protect you...${prompt}
What? What about the past, you say?
Of course the magic won't travel through time.
But not an altogether pointless, one. The powers of thirtfy transit do seem to apply across the space-time continuum, kupo.${prompt}
The whole system is filled with mysteries.${prompt}
Oh, it's you! It's really you!
The brave adventurer who discovered one of our mog tablets!${prompt}
It's a pleasure, an honor to meet you, kupo!
We have a special prize to reward you for your efforts.
If you'll just sign right here...${prompt}
As a reward for your efforts, please have this!
Many thanks, and ${choice: 0}[safe travels/Happy Vana'versary], kupo!${prompt}
What? You won't? That's a shame, kupo.
I had a special prize here just for you, but without your signature, I'll just have to hold on to it...${prompt}
If you change your mind, come back quickly.
The mog tablets will be scattered to the wind again at any moment, kupo...${prompt}

Much have I heard of you from Joachim.${prompt}
Moniquaurie is my name, and I, too, am a native of Abyssea.${prompt}
There exist two cavernous maws here in the Jugner Forest, although you may have noted a difference.${prompt}
It intrigues me as to what has caused the one to be turned to stone.
However, I haven't the luxury of time to be sating my own curiosities.${prompt}
The two of us have matters of far graver import to discuss.${prompt}
Firstly, you would do well to know that this maw is connected not to the Jugner Forest of Abyssea, but instead, the Vunkerl Inlet.${prompt}
Some have theorized that a dimensional misalignment has caused this, but you needn't rack your mind with academic ponderings.${prompt}
Are you familiar with the inlet? It is a place of beauty both wondrous and serene.${prompt}
But no more, for it was reft of its glorious vistas the day the sky turned crimson and hordes of abominations flooded the land.${prompt}
There is one thing I find puzzling, ${name-player}.
You've seen with your own eyes the sickly state of Abyssea, yet you insist on going there. What is it that drives you?${prompt}
Whatever your answer is, keep it to yourself.
It matters not whether your reason for setting foot in my home world be materialistic or altruistic.${prompt}
But enough pleasantries. I've come here for no other reason than to brief you on the current situation in Vunkerl, and brief you I shall.${prompt}

The resistance effort in the inlet is built around early model martellos whose functions are augmented via a central unit, the pulse martello. An outpost was secretly established especially for the purpose of housing the latter.${prompt}
Of late, however, the Abyssean hordes have taken to attacking the outpost with unnerving singleness of mind.
We can only conclude that the enemy have somehow learned of its strategic importance.${prompt}
Our defenses have held up thus far, but cannot indefinitely repel such a determined enemy offensive.
And to compound matters, Vunkerl's terrain places us at a distinct disadvantage against besiegers.${prompt}
Unless more people aid in the outpost's defense, the resistance effort in Vunkerl will surely end in failure.
I myself would've long since leapt into the fray, but I share the same fate as Joachim and can no longer return home...${prompt}
You just leave Vunkerl to me!
Joachim's trust in you is well-founded, it'd seem.${prompt}
Before you cross over to Abyssea, however, there is one piece of knowledge you should take with you.${prompt}
There is a fell creature that has been terrorizing Vunkerl, a gargantuan beast identified as a ruszor.
Countless soldiers and civilians alike have fallen prey to its dreadful tusks.${prompt}
I had heard that ruszors once thrived in great numbers in the Northlands, but were hunted to extinction soon after the Great War.${prompt}
How is it possible, then, that such a terrible specimen has survived to this day to now prowl the inlet, where none had been seen before?
Could the destabilizing boundary between worlds spoken of by that Tarutaru be the culprit behind such inexplicable occurrences?${prompt}
When that oddball member of the Resistance put forth this theory, we all mocked him for a fool...but now I wonder.
Regardless, I counsel you to avoid engaging that creature--the ruszor--until such time as you've acclimatized to Vunkerl's environs.${prompt}
I shall be praying for your success.${prompt}
Ah, so ${name-player} finally makes ${choice-player-gender}[his/her] triumphant return.${prompt}
Word of your amazing feat has preceded you.
I can still scarce believe that you truly did it--that you put an end to the tusked menace!${prompt}
I had known that people of your world are possessed of strength far above we Abysseans, but even that seems an understatement in light of your achievements.${prompt}
I can now rest easier in the knowledge that a terrible abomination threatens my people no more.
Thank you, ${name-player}, from the bottom of my heart.${prompt}
Please accept this as a token of my gratitude.${prompt}
It is a rare variety of the stone, its potential known to be fully unleashed when wielded by one of your kind.${prompt}
As I am permanently stranded upon this world, I no longer have a use for it.
May it serve you well upon the battlefield that is Abyssea.${prompt}
Thanks to the efforts of stalwarts such as you, we were able to acquire new intelligence from communities that had been surviving in isolation.${prompt}
Of the things we've learned, however, some were too terrible to be made known to the masses.
The hope that has sprouted among the survivors is yet too fragile to bear such knowledge.${prompt}
I gravely fear for what will become of my home, yet I am stranded here, powerless to lift even a finger.${prompt}
I shall never again lay eyes upon Abyssea.${prompt}
But through your eyes, I can almost glimpse it in all its glory and majesty--the way it was before the cataclysm befell.${prompt}
${name-player}. It is my fervent hope that you will continue to stand with us in the fight to save Abyssea.${prompt}

The Voidwatch is a fellowship of men and women come together to defend the world from extradimensional invaders called “Voidwalkers.” Driven only by an insatiable appetite for destruction, these fell horrors roam the space between dimensions, ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.${prompt}
Faced with the risk of mass invasion, Voidwatch leaders devised a strategy wherein potential threats are preemptively neutralized.
This act was made possible through the discovery of voidstones, magicked objects capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible to be summarily dispatched.${prompt}
Such efforts to stem the rise of Voidwalkers, collectively dubbed “Voidwatch Operations,” or “Ops” for short, take place in the vicinity of planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space.${prompt}

A single person may initiate a Voidwatch operation, at which time “Voidwatcher” status will be bestowed upon all qualifying party and alliance members, allowing them to commence battle with the target Voidwalker.${prompt}

Voidwatch Ops are subject to a time limit. Exceed this limit and Voidwatcher status will be revoked for all involved, bringing the confrontation to an end. Individuals straying too far from the site of battle, too, will find themselves relieved of the status.${prompt}
Know also that those who take on the burden of the Voidwatcher become temporarily isolated and unable to receive aid from the outside world.
Such is the arduous nature of transdimensional encounters.${prompt}
Initiating a Voidwatch operation requires a voidstone, as well as a stratum abyssite attuned to a particular planar rift.${prompt}
Only one person needs to be in possession of these objects for all party and alliance members to participate.${prompt}
However, there exists a number of participation conditions that must be observed.${prompt}
When an operation commences, a single voidstone will be expended for all who possess it.
These combatants will have the opportunity to improve their spoils by manipulating spectral alignment values during battle.${prompt}
Conversely, those not possessing their own voidstone will be limited in the spoils they can obtain.${prompt}
The “voidstone” is a magicked object which, when coupled with stratum abyssite, is capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible.${prompt}
Only a single combatant need possess a voidstone to allow all party and alliance members to participate in a Voidwatch operation.
Those without one, however, will find their spoils limited in both quantity and quality.${prompt}
As a single voidstone is automatically expended when the battle commences, it is recommended that you keep stock of your inventory.${prompt}
Those wishing to obtain the stones should speak to a Voidwatch officer, who is charged with issuing a set quantity at fixed intervals.${prompt}
Stratum abyssite are dynamic stones capable of evolution. By absorbing the energies emitted by felled Voidwalkers, they become attuned with other planar rifts.${prompt}
After defeating your quarry, present your stone to an atmacite refiner--specialists in the study of otherworld geology--to have its properties determined.${prompt}
Stratum abyssite growth occurs independently of voidstones, and the latter is not required to trigger development.${prompt}

Each dimension is composed of its own existential spectrum to which objects of that world are aligned. The act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning oneself to its existential spectrum.${prompt}

While Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with such creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.${prompt}

Compensating measures, however, exist which allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe. One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as “ascent items.”${prompt}
Alignment values raised through ascent items will remain in place until such time as a riftworn pyxis is opened at the end of a successful operation.${prompt}
Those participating in Voidwatch Ops are recommended to plan ahead in order to make effective use of ascent items.${prompt}
Alignment values can also be raised in the midst of battle by striking at enemy weaknesses, causing their existential attunement to shift to your advantage.${prompt}

Blows can be dealt with abilities such as weapon skills and magic spells, and your choice of weakness and the manner in which you strike it will determine which hue of the alignment spectrum is affected.${prompt}
The existential spectrum is comprised of five lights (blue, red, yellow, green, and white), each of which influences reward yield.${prompt}
The precise workings of each light can be reviewed when examining your current alignment values.${prompt}
Upon the successful conclusion of battle, the alignment bonus as granted by ascent items and the exploitation of enemy weaknesses are combined to determine the spoils.${prompt}

Be forewarned: Voidwalkers are highly guileful beings and will not suffer the same weakness being struck twice. Combatants must be on constant watch for any changes that may occur during the course of battle.${prompt}
Atmacite is the physical agglomeration of a monster's soul, and a vessel for its feral instincts.
By infusing atmacite to one's body using ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}, it is possible to enhance one's battle prowess.${prompt}
Be aware, however, that powers granted by atmacite can be tapped only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.${prompt}
Atmacite is resilient and will not be expended in the infusion process.${prompt}
Furthermore, infused atmacite will remain in place until voluntarily purged.${prompt}
As the configuration of atmacite is not possible during an operation, be sure to see to your battle preparations ahead of time.${prompt}
Cruor can be used to enrich atmacite, enhancing its potency. The amount of cruor required for enrichment and the resultant properties vary with atmacite.${prompt}
Atmacite can be enriched in stages to a maximum of level ${number: 0}.${prompt}
All Voidwatchers are urged to make atmacite enrichment a priority, for they might just mean the difference between life and death.${prompt}
Periapt are lucky charms that grant myriad beneficial effects ranging from improved vitality to general upturns in fortune.${prompt}
Especially sought after are those bestowing temporary items at the commencement of an operation, granting combatants a distinct advantage against the enemy.${prompt}
Although their acquisition can only be described as arduous, the benefits make them well worth the effort.${prompt}

I know it may look as if I'm standing around with not a care in the world, but that's all part of the plan.
You, however, are not. Stop interfering with my duties.${prompt}
Oho, I can tell from your behavioral patterns and the accoutrements with which you adorn yourself that you're a ${choice-player-gender}[man/woman] of the 'Watch.${prompt}
How about I let you in on some trade secrets?
All I ask is that you refrain from sharing them with every Tomasa, Dixon, and Harith.${prompt}
Pulse Panoplia is the term our researchers have bestowed upon a specific set of equipment that emits an entrancing luminescence, such as ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}

Our brightest minds in the experimental field of Opticogradiology have succeeded in stabilizing the particles that constitute the source of this enigmatic light, a phenomenon which is often referred to as a “pulse.”${prompt}

Therefore, as you may have inferred, pulse panoplia are the visual structures yielded by such procedures. I use the phrase “visual structures” here because these pulses do not technically possess a singular, concrete form.${prompt}
The details of these pulses are highly classified, and I am not at liberty to make them privy to the rank and file.
While you may not have access to all the particulars on them, you will surely encounter these particle aggregates on the field of battle.${prompt}
Much like the legendary swords of the Far East, it is not the adventurer who chooses the pulse panoplia, but the pulse that chooses to initiate an exclusive bond with its owner.
In the past, if one tried to bequeath such equipment to a comrade...${prompt}
The pulse would dissolve in an instant, leaving the recipient with naught but a feeling of dissatisfaction.${prompt}
However, our passionate scientists have finally uncovered a method by which to permanently regulate the activity of these pulses.
They worked day-in and day-out, and their lives suffered as a consequence; they forgot their families, friends, and all other obligations.${prompt}
If pulses disperse when handed to a new owner, then it follows that all one need do is regather the particles and restabilize them.
The reasoning involved is quite elementary, my dear ${name-player}.${prompt}
“How does one go about procuring these pulse particles,” you ask?
An astute question for someone of such a brutish vocation. I could lecture for hours concerning this unfathomably deep topic...but I won't.${prompt}
For brevity's sake, I shall cite only the most basic facts that delineate their connection to Voidwatchers.${prompt}
It is well documented that pulses exhibit a certain response in the presence of stratum abyssite.
Thus, it stands to reason that anyone in possession of said abyssite would collect pulse particles in the form of pulse cells.${prompt}
Sadly, that is neither the final nor most difficult step here. Reconstruction is the most integral aspect of the process.${prompt}

Our studies have shown that pulse particles lose a vast amount of their energy as heat and other byproducts of dispersion, meaning it is empirically impossible to restore a pulse to its former level of effectiveness.${prompt}
By the by, I may have promised a brief explanation, but those are hard to come by when such vast stores of knowledge are involved.
Returning to the matter at hand...${prompt}
The essence of what I'm trying to convey is that a one-to-one ratio of pre- to post-dispersion pulses is simply not viable.${prompt}
Notice how I qualified “ratio” with “one-to-one.” While individual pulses may lack potency, it is possible to augment that dearth with additional pulses.${prompt}

The latest double-blind, peer-reviewed experiment conducted at our research center determined that at least ${number: 0} ${choice-plurality: 0}[post-dispersion pulse is/post-dispersion pulses are] needed to replicate the power of an original one.${prompt}

As a corollary, though, I must add that one cannot go around collecting any old cells and expect to recreate a masterpiece as delicate as a pulse; the pulse cells you acquire must all be of the same ilk.${prompt}

Once you obtain ${number: 0} ${choice-plurality: 0}[pulse cell/pulse cells], all you have to do is relinquish them to me. I shall do my utmost to reconstruct the pulse panoplia of my--<ahem> your dreams.${prompt}
That is, if you possess the necessary faculties for a pulse to initiate a bond with you.
Hopefully my explanation didn't fly too high over that microscopic brain of yours, although I never tire of conversing on this subject.${prompt}
You truly want to know about our latest innovation?
I suppose it is technology's job to assist physically challenged specimens like you and turn them into powerful pugilists.${prompt}
Perhaps it would be wrong to place an inordinate amount of blame on you, though, seeing as these fiends hail from another dimension.${prompt}
As you probably don't recall, there are five distinct chronospatial shifts that factor into Voidwalker combat that we term “phases.”
If we are to defeat these extra-planar perambulators, we must utilize the full spectrum of these rifts by--${prompt}
Yes, aligning with your foe. So it would seem you are not completely illiterate on this subject.
Providing remedial courses to cranially challenged individuals is malms beneath me, however. If you need a refresher on the science behind alignment, go harass a Voidwatch Officer.${prompt}
All I'll say on this topic is that alignment is analogous to a cross-dimensional bridge.${prompt}
What a fitting analogy, if I do say so myself.

These monstrosities start out as massive crevasses separating you and your contingent from the sweet nectar of victory, but once the bridge is completed, the path to victory is vastly more accessible.${prompt}
And what, pray tell, is the name of the extraordinary artifact that lays the foundation for this metaphorical bridge to triumph?
A splendid name for a splendid invention, wouldn't you agree?

Simply place ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} within the proximity of a planar rift, and gaze in awe at the resulting ${keyitem-singular: 2[2]}, which should make the power of your ${keyitem-singular: 1[2]} surge exponentially!${prompt}
Furthermore, deploying ${keyitem-plural: 0[2]} at the beginning of battle will precipitate shifts in phase alignment.${prompt}
These special shifts then significantly alter the alignment's effects, thus inhibiting the most deadly aspects of your Voidwalker enemy.${prompt}

I doubt someone outside of avant-garde research circles such as you can fully conceptualize the plethora of mechanisms that comprise this sublime process, but perhaps a more perspicuous way to state the consequences would be “The baddies get weaker.”${prompt}
Keep in mind, however, you must manually catalyze any alignment shifts you wish to exploit.${prompt}
One of these alone will not make a significant difference in battle.
Don't start complaining to me, though, for our efforts to eliminate this defect are already well underway.${prompt}
At any rate, while one ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} may be insufficient, adventurers are allowed to carry up to ${number: 1} at a time.${prompt}

Why that few!? Anyone with even the most rudimentary understanding of chronospatial alignment could deduce that an excess of these objects could destabilize nearby planar rifts and cause irreparable damage to the surrounding area!
Besides, no one would need more than ${number: 1} per operation anyway.${prompt}
Oh, and don't think that I'll just be giving these away!
You're lucky you're not being charged for the privilege of listening to my scholarly discourse!${prompt}
I may be loath to admit it, but we desperately need the money to continue researching and developing these artifacts.
There still is an alarming dearth of data on the items' negative side effects--vis-a-vis planar rifts--that must still be addressed.${prompt}
There you have it; our secret weapon.
I suggest relying on it as little as possible, though, in case the Voidwalkers ever develop an immunity to it.${prompt}
As for the pecuniary particulars, I'd say ${number: 1} gil for one ${item-singular: 0[2]} is a fair price.${prompt}
Remember, ${item-plural: 0[2]} are in short supply, so there is a requisite waiting period after purchases.${prompt}
How many ${item-plural: 0[2]} do you wish to procure?${prompt}
That'll be ${number: 1} gil, for simpletons who don't pay attention.${prompt}
...Do you even know how to count? Come back when you have sufficient gil.${prompt}
Why don't you people understand that genius can't be rushed!? If you truly want some ${item-plural: 0[2]}, you'll have to wait until the next batch is manufactured.${prompt}
I have my doubts as to your competence, but I can't argue with your ${number: 1} gil. Here, take your ${number: 2} ${item-given-plurality: 2[2], 0[2]}.${prompt}
I have my doubts as to your competence, but I can't argue with your ${number: 1} gil. Here, take your ${number: 2} ${item-given-plurality: 2[2], 0[2]}.${prompt}
You can complete your operations without the aid of our ${item-singular: 0[2]}, you say?
It grieves me to know that our creations will go unutilized, but I applaud the caliber of your character.${prompt}
You may watch if you so desire, but I doubt you possess the intellectual capacity to comprehend what you'll be seeing.${prompt}
As I expected, it's ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}. Cherish this with all your being, for it is a testament to the wonders of science.${prompt}
You haven't the requisite amount of ${item-plural: 0[2]}, you lackwit. I'll need ${number: 1} of them in order to ensure a successful reconstruction.${prompt}
I believe I explicitly stated that pulse panoplia choose their owner, not the other way around. You simply don't possess the necessary fortitude to be chosen by this pulse.${prompt}
Ugh, will your stupidity never cease?
I can't reconstruct any pulse panoplia out of this ${item-singular: 0[2]} until you clear some space in your inventory.${prompt}
A palpable force wells up slowly from beneath the surface...${prompt}
This geomagnetic fount has already been recorded.${prompt}
You have successfully recorded the phenomenon. Now it is time to report your findings to Anastase.${prompt}
Your records surrounding the current geomagnetic phenomenon had been fading, but your use of the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} has restored them to normal!${prompt}
